turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Nudie Suits.
turn.1: What can you tell me about The Nudie Suits?
turn.2: The Nudie Suits The Nudie Suits were a New Zealand band consisting of Mark Lyons (vocals, guitar) and sisters Dionne Taylor (steel guitar, harmony vocals, autoharp) and Tam Taylor (violin).
turn.4: They began their career in Auckland but relocated to Melbourne for a few years in the early 2000s.
turn.6: The band released two albums on Lil' Chief Records.
turn.7: Did Songbook get any good reviews?
turn.8: The Nudie Suits debut album Songbook received some excellent reviews and was described as "Something of tremendous, charm and enormous vitality." by Chris Knox of Real Groove Magazine.
turn.9: Did Sweetacres get any good reviews?
turn.10: Their follow-up album, Sweetacres, was a concept album based on Lyons' childhood in an Auckland suburb and was said to "exude(s) the vintage charm and warm glow of an antique valve radio", according to Russel Baillie from The New Zealand Herald.
turn.11: Did they release any other albums?
turn.12: A third Nudie Suits album was announced in 2008, to feature a new rhythm section of Rob Collins (bass) and Ivan Hyphen Johnston (drums), but has not, to present, eventuated.
